subject: Photography
title: Shadow Patterns Through Objects
description: A short lesson to help you apply Shadow Patterns Through Objects.

hook.text: Blinds cast striped shadows across a face. Leaves dapple light on a wall. Patterns through objects mesmerize.

buildup.text: When light passes through textured or perforated objects, it projects patterns onto surfaces behind them.

discovery.text: These projected patterns add visual interest, texture, and a sense of place to photographs.

twist.text: The shadow pattern often tells you more about the environment than showing the object itself would.

climax.text: Photographers seek out shadow patterns â€” window blinds, fences, tree canopies â€” as creative elements.

punchline.text: The prettiest patterns are made by light, not paint.
